Browse the source code of netbsd/external/lgpl3/mpfr/dist/src/gamma.c

1/* mpfr_gamma -- gamma function
2
3Copyright 2001-2018 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
4Contributed by the AriC and Caramba projects, INRIA.
5
6This file is part of the GNU MPFR Library.
7
8The GNU MPFR Library is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify
9it under the terms of the GNU Lesser General Public License as published by
10the Free Software Foundation; either version 3 of the License, or (at your
11option) any later version.
12
13The GNU MPFR Library is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but
14WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY
15or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU Lesser General Public
16License for more details.
17
18You should have received a copy of the GNU Lesser General Public License
19along with the GNU MPFR Library; see the file COPYING.LESSER. If not, see
20http://www.gnu.org/licenses/ or write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc.,
2151 Franklin St, Fifth Floor, Boston, MA 02110-1301, USA. */
22
23#define MPFR_NEED_LONGLONG_H
24#include "mpfr-impl.h"
25
26#define IS_GAMMA
27#include "lngamma.c"
28#undef IS_GAMMA
29
30/* return a sufficient precision such that 2-x is exact, assuming x < 0
31 and x is not an integer */
32static mpfr_prec_t
33mpfr_gamma_2_minus_x_exact (mpfr_srcptr x)
34{
35 /* Since x < 0, 2-x = 2+y with y := -x.
36 If y < 2, a precision w >= PREC(y) + EXP(2)-EXP(y) = PREC(y) + 2 - EXP(y)
37 is enough, since no overlap occurs in 2+y, so no carry happens.
38 If y >= 2, either ULP(y) <= 2, and we need w >= PREC(y)+1 since a
39 carry can occur, or ULP(y) > 2, and we need w >= EXP(y)-1:
40 (a) if EXP(y) <= 1, w = PREC(y) + 2 - EXP(y)
41 (b) if EXP(y) > 1 and EXP(y)-PREC(y) <= 1, w = PREC(y) + 1
42 (c) if EXP(y) > 1 and EXP(y)-PREC(y) > 1, w = EXP(y) - 1.
43
44 Note: case (c) cannot happen in practice since this would imply that
45 y is integer, thus x is negative integer */
46 return (MPFR_GET_EXP(x) <= 1) ? MPFR_PREC(x) + 2 - MPFR_GET_EXP(x)
47 : MPFR_PREC(x) + 1;
48}
49
50/* return a sufficient precision such that 1-x is exact, assuming x < 1
51 and x is not an integer */
52static mpfr_prec_t
53mpfr_gamma_1_minus_x_exact (mpfr_srcptr x)
54{
55 if (MPFR_IS_POS(x))
56 return MPFR_PREC(x) - MPFR_GET_EXP(x);
57 else if (MPFR_GET_EXP(x) <= 0)
58 return MPFR_PREC(x) + 1 - MPFR_GET_EXP(x);
59 else /* necessarily MPFR_PREC(x) > MPFR_GET_EXP(x) since otherwise
60 x would be an integer */
61 return MPFR_PREC(x) + 1;
62}
63
64/* returns a lower bound of the number of significant bits of n!
65 (not counting the low zero bits).
66 We know n! >= (n/e)^n*sqrt(2*Pi*n) for n >= 1, and the number of zero bits
67 is floor(n/2) + floor(n/4) + floor(n/8) + ...
68 This approximation is exact for n <= 500000, except for n = 219536, 235928,
69 298981, 355854, 464848, 493725, 498992 where it returns a value 1 too small.
70*/
71static unsigned long
72bits_fac (unsigned long n)
73{
74 mpfr_t x, y;
75 unsigned long r, k;
76 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_DECL (expo);
77
78 MPFR_ASSERTD (n >= 1);
79
80 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_MARK (expo);
81 mpfr_init2 (x, 38);
82 mpfr_init2 (y, 38);
83 mpfr_set_ui (x, n, MPFR_RNDZ);
84 mpfr_set_str_binary (y, "10.101101111110000101010001011000101001"); /* upper bound of e */
85 mpfr_div (x, x, y, MPFR_RNDZ);
86 mpfr_pow_ui (x, x, n, MPFR_RNDZ);
87 mpfr_const_pi (y, MPFR_RNDZ);
88 mpfr_mul_ui (y, y, 2 * n, MPFR_RNDZ);
89 mpfr_sqrt (y, y, MPFR_RNDZ);
90 mpfr_mul (x, x, y, MPFR_RNDZ);
91 mpfr_log2 (x, x, MPFR_RNDZ);
92 r = mpfr_get_ui (x, MPFR_RNDU); /* lower bound on ceil(x) */
93 for (k = 2; k <= n; k *= 2)
94 {
95 /* Note: the approximation is accurate enough so that the
96 subtractions do not wrap. */
97 MPFR_ASSERTD (r >= n / k);
98 r -= n / k;
99 }
100 mpfr_clear (x);
101 mpfr_clear (y);
102 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_FREE (expo);
103
104 return r;
105}
106
107/* We use the reflection formula
108 Gamma(1+t) Gamma(1-t) = - Pi t / sin(Pi (1 + t))
109 in order to treat the case x <= 1,
110 i.e. with x = 1-t, then Gamma(x) = -Pi*(1-x)/sin(Pi*(2-x))/GAMMA(2-x)
111*/
112int
113mpfr_gamma (mpfr_ptr gamma, mpfr_srcptr x, mpfr_rnd_t rnd_mode)
114{
115 mpfr_t xp, GammaTrial, tmp, tmp2;
116 mpz_t fact;
117 mpfr_prec_t realprec;
118 int compared, is_integer;
119 int inex = 0; /* 0 means: result gamma not set yet */
120 MPFR_GROUP_DECL (group);
121 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_DECL (expo);
122 MPFR_ZIV_DECL (loop);
123
124 MPFR_LOG_FUNC
125 (("x[%Pu]=%.*Rg rnd=%d", mpfr_get_prec (x), mpfr_log_prec, x, rnd_mode),
126 ("gamma[%Pu]=%.*Rg inexact=%d",
127 mpfr_get_prec (gamma), mpfr_log_prec, gamma, inex));
128
129 /* Trivial cases */
130 if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (MPFR_IS_SINGULAR (x)))
131 {
132 if (MPFR_IS_NAN (x))
133 {
134 MPFR_SET_NAN (gamma);
135 MPFR_RET_NAN;
136 }
137 else if (MPFR_IS_INF (x))
138 {
139 if (MPFR_IS_NEG (x))
140 {
141 MPFR_SET_NAN (gamma);
142 MPFR_RET_NAN;
143 }
144 else
145 {
146 MPFR_SET_INF (gamma);
147 MPFR_SET_POS (gamma);
148 MPFR_RET (0); /* exact */
149 }
150 }
151 else /* x is zero */
152 {
153 MPFR_ASSERTD(MPFR_IS_ZERO(x));
154 MPFR_SET_INF(gamma);
155 MPFR_SET_SAME_SIGN(gamma, x);
156 MPFR_SET_DIVBY0 ();
157 MPFR_RET (0); /* exact */
158 }
159 }
160
161 /* Check for tiny arguments, where gamma(x) ~ 1/x - euler + ... can be
162 approximated by 1/x, with some error term ~= - euler.
163 We need to make sure that there are no breakpoints (discontinuity
164 points of the rounding function) between gamma(x) and 1/x (included),
165 where the possible breakpoints (for all rounding modes) are the numbers
166 that fit on PREC(gamma)+1 bits. There will be a special case when |x|
167 is a power of two, since such values are breakpoints. We will choose n
168 minimum such that x fits on n bits and the breakpoints fit on n+1 bits,
169 thus
170 n = MAX(MPFR_PREC(x), MPFR_PREC(gamma)).
171 We know from "Bound on Runs of Zeros and Ones for Algebraic Functions",
172 Proceedings of Arith15, T. Lang and J.-M. Muller, 2001, that the maximal
173 number of consecutive zeroes or ones after the round bit for 1/x is n-1
174 for an input x of n bits [this is an actually much older result!].
175 But we need a more precise lower bound. Assume that 1/x is near a
176 breakpoint y. From the definition of n, the input x fits on n bits
177 and the breakpoint y fits on of n+1 bits. We can write x = X*2^e,
178 y = Y/2^f with X, Y integers of n and n+1 bits respectively.
179 Thus X*Y^2^(e-f) is near 1, i.e., X*Y is near the integer 2^(f-e).
180 Two cases can happen:
181 (i) either X*Y is exactly 2^(f-e), but this can happen only if X and Y
182 are themselves powers of two, i.e., x is a power of two;
183 (ii) or X*Y is at distance at least one from 2^(f-e), thus
184 |xy-1| >= 2^(e-f), or |y-1/x| >= 2^(e-f)/x = 2^(-f)/X >= 2^(-f-n).
185 Since ufp(y) = 2^(n-f) [ufp = unit in first place], this means
186 that the distance |y-1/x| >= 2^(-2n) ufp(y).
187 Now, assuming |gamma(x)-1/x| < 1, which is true for 0 < x <= 1,
188 if 2^(-2n) ufp(y) >= 1, then gamma(x) and 1/x round in the same
189 way, so that rounding 1/x gives the correct result and correct
190 (nonzero) ternary value.
191 If x < 2^E, then y >= 2^(-E), thus ufp(y) >= 2^(-E).
192 A sufficient condition is thus EXP(x) <= -2n, where
193 n = MAX(MPFR_PREC(x), MPFR_PREC(gamma)).
194 */
195 /* TODO: The above proof uses the same precision for input and output.
196 Without this assumption, one might obtain a bound like
197 PREC(x) + PREC(y) instead of 2 MAX(PREC(x),PREC(y)). */
198 /* TODO: Handle the very small arguments that do not satisfy the condition,
199 by using the approximation 1/x - euler and a Ziv loop. Otherwise, after
200 some tests, even Gamma(1+x)/x would be faster than the generic code. */
201 if (MPFR_GET_EXP (x)
202 <= -2 * (mpfr_exp_t) MAX(MPFR_PREC(x), MPFR_PREC(gamma)))
203 {
204 int sign = MPFR_SIGN (x); /* retrieve sign before possible override */
205 int special;
206 MPFR_BLOCK_DECL (flags);
207
208 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_MARK (expo);
209
210 /* for overflow cases, see below; this needs to be done
211 before x possibly gets overridden. */
212 special =
213 MPFR_GET_EXP (x) == 1 - MPFR_EMAX_MAX &&
214 MPFR_IS_POS_SIGN (sign) &&
215 MPFR_IS_LIKE_RNDD (rnd_mode, sign) &&
216 mpfr_powerof2_raw (x);
217
218 MPFR_BLOCK (flags, inex = mpfr_ui_div (gamma, 1, x, rnd_mode));
219 if (inex == 0) /* |x| is a power of two */
220 {
221 /* return RND(1/x - euler) = RND(+/- 2^k - eps) with eps > 0 */
222 if (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN || MPFR_IS_LIKE_RNDU (rnd_mode, sign))
223 inex = 1;
224 else
225 {
226 mpfr_nextbelow (gamma);
227 inex = -1;
228 }
229 }
230 else if (MPFR_UNLIKELY (MPFR_OVERFLOW (flags)))
231 {
232 /* Overflow in the division 1/x. This is a real overflow, except
233 in RNDZ or RNDD when 1/x = 2^emax, i.e. x = 2^(-emax): due to
234 the "- euler", the rounded value in unbounded exponent range
235 is 0.111...11 * 2^emax (not an overflow). */
236 if (!special)
237 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_UPDATE_FLAGS (expo, flags);
238 }
239 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_FREE (expo);
240 /* Note: an overflow is possible with an infinite result;
241 in this case, the overflow flag will automatically be
242 restored by mpfr_check_range. */
243 return mpfr_check_range (gamma, inex, rnd_mode);
244 }
245
246 is_integer = mpfr_integer_p (x);
247 /* gamma(x) for x a negative integer gives NaN */
248 if (is_integer && MPFR_IS_NEG(x))
249 {
250 MPFR_SET_NAN (gamma);
251 MPFR_RET_NAN;
252 }
253
254 compared = mpfr_cmp_ui (x, 1);
255 if (compared == 0)
256 return mpfr_set_ui (gamma, 1, rnd_mode);
257
258 /* if x is an integer that fits into an unsigned long, use mpfr_fac_ui
259 if argument is not too large.
260 If precision is p, fac_ui costs O(u*p), whereas gamma costs O(p*M(p)),
261 so for u <= M(p), fac_ui should be faster.
262 We approximate here M(p) by p*log(p)^2, which is not a bad guess.
263 Warning: since the generic code does not handle exact cases,
264 we want all cases where gamma(x) is exact to be treated here.
265 */
266 if (is_integer && mpfr_fits_ulong_p (x, MPFR_RNDN))
267 {
268 unsigned long int u;
269 mpfr_prec_t p = MPFR_PREC(gamma);
270 u = mpfr_get_ui (x, MPFR_RNDN);
271 MPFR_ASSERTD (u >= 2);
272 if (u < 44787929UL && bits_fac (u - 1) <= p + (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN))
273 /* bits_fac: lower bound on the number of bits of m,
274 where gamma(x) = (u-1)! = m*2^e with m odd. */
275 return mpfr_fac_ui (gamma, u - 1, rnd_mode);
276 /* if bits_fac(...) > p (resp. p+1 for rounding to nearest),
277 then gamma(x) cannot be exact in precision p (resp. p+1).
278 FIXME: remove the test u < 44787929UL after changing bits_fac
279 to return a mpz_t or mpfr_t. */
280 }
281
282 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_MARK (expo);
283
284 /* check for overflow: according to (6.1.37) in Abramowitz & Stegun,
285 gamma(x) >= exp(-x) * x^(x-1/2) * sqrt(2*Pi)
286 >= 2 * (x/e)^x / x for x >= 1 */
287 if (compared > 0)
288 {
289 mpfr_t yp, zp;
290 mpfr_exp_t expxp;
291 MPFR_BLOCK_DECL (flags);
292 MPFR_GROUP_DECL (group);
293
294 /* quick test for the default exponent range */
295 if (mpfr_get_emax () >= 1073741823UL && MPFR_GET_EXP(x) <= 25)
296 {
297 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_FREE (expo);
298 return mpfr_gamma_aux (gamma, x, rnd_mode);
299 }
300
301 MPFR_GROUP_INIT_3 (group, 53, xp, yp, zp);
302 /* 1/e rounded down to 53 bits */
303 mpfr_set_str_binary (zp,
304 "0.010111100010110101011000110110001011001110111100111");
305 mpfr_mul (xp, x, zp, MPFR_RNDZ);
306 mpfr_sub_ui (yp, x, 2, MPFR_RNDZ);
307 mpfr_pow (xp, xp, yp, MPFR_RNDZ); /* (x/e)^(x-2) */
308 mpfr_mul (xp, xp, zp, MPFR_RNDZ); /* x^(x-2) / e^(x-1) */
309 mpfr_mul (xp, xp, zp, MPFR_RNDZ); /* x^(x-2) / e^x */
310 mpfr_mul (xp, xp, x, MPFR_RNDZ); /* lower bound on x^(x-1) / e^x */
311 MPFR_BLOCK (flags, mpfr_mul_2ui (xp, xp, 1, MPFR_RNDZ));
312 expxp = MPFR_GET_EXP (xp);
313 MPFR_GROUP_CLEAR (group);
314 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_FREE (expo);
315 return MPFR_OVERFLOW (flags) || expxp > __gmpfr_emax ?
316 mpfr_overflow (gamma, rnd_mode, 1) :
317 mpfr_gamma_aux (gamma, x, rnd_mode);
318 }
319
320 /* now compared < 0 */
321
322 /* check for underflow: for x < 1,
323 gamma(x) = Pi*(x-1)/sin(Pi*(2-x))/gamma(2-x).
324 Since gamma(2-x) >= 2 * ((2-x)/e)^(2-x) / (2-x), we have
325 |gamma(x)| <= Pi*(1-x)*(2-x)/2/((2-x)/e)^(2-x) / |sin(Pi*(2-x))|
326 <= 12 * ((2-x)/e)^x / |sin(Pi*(2-x))|.
327 To avoid an underflow in ((2-x)/e)^x, we compute the logarithm.
328 */
329 if (MPFR_IS_NEG(x))
330 {
331 int underflow = 0, sgn, ck;
332 mpfr_prec_t w;
333
334 mpfr_init2 (xp, 53);
335 mpfr_init2 (tmp, 53);
336 mpfr_init2 (tmp2, 53);
337 /* we want an upper bound for x * [log(2-x)-1].
338 since x < 0, we need a lower bound on log(2-x) */
339 mpfr_ui_sub (xp, 2, x, MPFR_RNDD);
340 mpfr_log (xp, xp, MPFR_RNDD);
341 mpfr_sub_ui (xp, xp, 1, MPFR_RNDD);
342 mpfr_mul (xp, xp, x, MPFR_RNDU);
343
344 /* we need an upper bound on 1/|sin(Pi*(2-x))|,
345 thus a lower bound on |sin(Pi*(2-x))|.
346 If 2-x is exact, then the error of Pi*(2-x) is (1+u)^2 with u = 2^(-p)
347 thus the error on sin(Pi*(2-x)) is less than 1/2ulp + 3Pi(2-x)u,
348 assuming u <= 1, thus <= u + 3Pi(2-x)u */
349
350 w = mpfr_gamma_2_minus_x_exact (x); /* 2-x is exact for prec >= w */
351 w += 17; /* to get tmp2 small enough */
352 mpfr_set_prec (tmp, w);
353 mpfr_set_prec (tmp2, w);
354 MPFR_DBGRES (ck = mpfr_ui_sub (tmp, 2, x, MPFR_RNDN));
355 MPFR_ASSERTD (ck == 0); /* tmp = 2-x exactly */
356 mpfr_const_pi (tmp2, MPFR_RNDN);
357 mpfr_mul (tmp2, tmp2, tmp, MPFR_RNDN); /* Pi*(2-x) */
358 mpfr_sin (tmp, tmp2, MPFR_RNDN); /* sin(Pi*(2-x)) */
359 sgn = mpfr_sgn (tmp);
360 mpfr_abs (tmp, tmp, MPFR_RNDN);
361 mpfr_mul_ui (tmp2, tmp2, 3, MPFR_RNDU); /* 3Pi(2-x) */
362 mpfr_add_ui (tmp2, tmp2, 1, MPFR_RNDU); /* 3Pi(2-x)+1 */
363 mpfr_div_2ui (tmp2, tmp2, mpfr_get_prec (tmp), MPFR_RNDU);
364 /* if tmp2<|tmp|, we get a lower bound */
365 if (mpfr_cmp (tmp2, tmp) < 0)
366 {
367 mpfr_sub (tmp, tmp, tmp2, MPFR_RNDZ); /* low bnd on |sin(Pi*(2-x))| */
368 mpfr_ui_div (tmp, 12, tmp, MPFR_RNDU); /* upper bound */
369 mpfr_log2 (tmp, tmp, MPFR_RNDU);
370 mpfr_add (xp, tmp, xp, MPFR_RNDU);
371 /* The assert below checks that expo.saved_emin - 2 always
372 fits in a long. FIXME if we want to allow mpfr_exp_t to
373 be a long long, for instance. */
374 MPFR_ASSERTN (MPFR_EMIN_MIN - 2 >= LONG_MIN);
375 underflow = mpfr_cmp_si (xp, expo.saved_emin - 2) <= 0;
376 }
377
378 mpfr_clear (xp);
379 mpfr_clear (tmp);
380 mpfr_clear (tmp2);
381 if (underflow) /* the sign is the opposite of that of sin(Pi*(2-x)) */
382 {
383 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_FREE (expo);
384 return mpfr_underflow (gamma, (rnd_mode == MPFR_RNDN) ? MPFR_RNDZ : rnd_mode, -sgn);
385 }
386 }
387
388 realprec = MPFR_PREC (gamma);
389 /* we want both 1-x and 2-x to be exact */
390 {
391 mpfr_prec_t w;
392 w = mpfr_gamma_1_minus_x_exact (x);
393 if (realprec < w)
394 realprec = w;
395 w = mpfr_gamma_2_minus_x_exact (x);
396 if (realprec < w)
397 realprec = w;
398 }
399 realprec = realprec + MPFR_INT_CEIL_LOG2 (realprec) + 20;
400 MPFR_ASSERTD(realprec >= 5);
401
402 MPFR_GROUP_INIT_4 (group, realprec + MPFR_INT_CEIL_LOG2 (realprec) + 20,
403 xp, tmp, tmp2, GammaTrial);
404 mpz_init (fact);
405 MPFR_ZIV_INIT (loop, realprec);
406 for (;;)
407 {
408 mpfr_exp_t err_g;
409 int ck;
410 MPFR_GROUP_REPREC_4 (group, realprec, xp, tmp, tmp2, GammaTrial);
411
412 /* reflection formula: gamma(x) = Pi*(x-1)/sin(Pi*(2-x))/gamma(2-x) */
413
414 ck = mpfr_ui_sub (xp, 2, x, MPFR_RNDN); /* 2-x, exact */
415 MPFR_ASSERTD(ck == 0); (void) ck; /* use ck to avoid a warning */
416 mpfr_gamma (tmp, xp, MPFR_RNDN); /* gamma(2-x), error (1+u) */
417 mpfr_const_pi (tmp2, MPFR_RNDN); /* Pi, error (1+u) */
418 mpfr_mul (GammaTrial, tmp2, xp, MPFR_RNDN); /* Pi*(2-x), error (1+u)^2 */
419 err_g = MPFR_GET_EXP(GammaTrial);
420 mpfr_sin (GammaTrial, GammaTrial, MPFR_RNDN); /* sin(Pi*(2-x)) */
421 /* If tmp is +Inf, we compute exp(lngamma(x)). */
422 if (mpfr_inf_p (tmp))
423 {
424 inex = mpfr_explgamma (gamma, x, &expo, tmp, tmp2, rnd_mode);
425 if (inex)
426 goto end;
427 else
428 goto ziv_next;
429 }
430 err_g = err_g + 1 - MPFR_GET_EXP(GammaTrial);
431 /* let g0 the true value of Pi*(2-x), g the computed value.
432 We have g = g0 + h with |h| <= |(1+u^2)-1|*g.
433 Thus sin(g) = sin(g0) + h' with |h'| <= |(1+u^2)-1|*g.
434 The relative error is thus bounded by |(1+u^2)-1|*g/sin(g)
435 <= |(1+u^2)-1|*2^err_g. <= 2.25*u*2^err_g for |u|<=1/4.
436 With the rounding error, this gives (0.5 + 2.25*2^err_g)*u. */
437 ck = mpfr_sub_ui (xp, x, 1, MPFR_RNDN); /* x-1, exact */
438 MPFR_ASSERTD(ck == 0); (void) ck; /* use ck to avoid a warning */
439 mpfr_mul (xp, tmp2, xp, MPFR_RNDN); /* Pi*(x-1), error (1+u)^2 */
440 mpfr_mul (GammaTrial, GammaTrial, tmp, MPFR_RNDN);
441 /* [1 + (0.5 + 2.25*2^err_g)*u]*(1+u)^2 = 1 + (2.5 + 2.25*2^err_g)*u
442 + (0.5 + 2.25*2^err_g)*u*(2u+u^2) + u^2.
443 For err_g <= realprec-2, we have (0.5 + 2.25*2^err_g)*u <=
444 0.5*u + 2.25/4 <= 0.6875 and u^2 <= u/4, thus
445 (0.5 + 2.25*2^err_g)*u*(2u+u^2) + u^2 <= 0.6875*(2u+u/4) + u/4
446 <= 1.8*u, thus the rel. error is bounded by (4.5 + 2.25*2^err_g)*u. */
447 mpfr_div (GammaTrial, xp, GammaTrial, MPFR_RNDN);
448 /* the error is of the form (1+u)^3/[1 + (4.5 + 2.25*2^err_g)*u].
449 For realprec >= 5 and err_g <= realprec-2, [(4.5 + 2.25*2^err_g)*u]^2
450 <= 0.71, and for |y|<=0.71, 1/(1-y) can be written 1+a*y with a<=4.
451 (1+u)^3 * (1+4*(4.5 + 2.25*2^err_g)*u)
452 = 1 + (21 + 9*2^err_g)*u + (57+27*2^err_g)*u^2 + (55+27*2^err_g)*u^3
453 + (18+9*2^err_g)*u^4
454 <= 1 + (21 + 9*2^err_g)*u + (57+27*2^err_g)*u^2 + (56+28*2^err_g)*u^3
455 <= 1 + (21 + 9*2^err_g)*u + (59+28*2^err_g)*u^2
456 <= 1 + (23 + 10*2^err_g)*u.
457 The final error is thus bounded by (23 + 10*2^err_g) ulps,
458 which is <= 2^6 for err_g<=2, and <= 2^(err_g+4) for err_g >= 2. */
459 err_g = (err_g <= 2) ? 6 : err_g + 4;
460
461 if (MPFR_LIKELY (MPFR_CAN_ROUND (GammaTrial, realprec - err_g,
462 MPFR_PREC(gamma), rnd_mode)))
463 break;
464
465 ziv_next:
466 MPFR_ZIV_NEXT (loop, realprec);
467 }
468
469 end:
470 MPFR_ZIV_FREE (loop);
471
472 if (inex == 0)
473 inex = mpfr_set (gamma, GammaTrial, rnd_mode);
474 MPFR_GROUP_CLEAR (group);
475 mpz_clear (fact);
476
477 MPFR_SAVE_EXPO_FREE (expo);
478 return mpfr_check_range (gamma, inex, rnd_mode);
479}
480
